alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 12 at 8:21PM CDT until April 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River At Scanlon affecting Carlton and South St. Louis zone. .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. The river is expected to go into flood earlier than previously forecast. For the Western Lake Superior...including Island Lake, Scanlon, Tyler Forks River at Stricker Road near Mellen, Odanah, Odanah... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St. Louis River At Scanlon. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs near Scanlon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 7.9 Wed 7 pm CDT 9.7 11.2 11.9 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon by 100 PM CDT.
